Package level

Class Level

java.lang.Object
level.Level
public class Level extends Object
The Level class defines and manages the structure of a game level. It encompasses various layers like actors, tiles, and items, along with properties such as level number, time limit, and dimensions. This class is responsible for initializing and managing the game level's state.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructs a Level object from a file.

  • Constructor Details

    • Level

      public Level()
      Default constructor for creating an empty level.

    • Level

      public Level(String fileName)
      Constructs a Level object from a file. Initializes the level based on the data from the specified file and writes the initial state to a reset file for later use.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file containing the level data.

  • Method Details

    • createLevel

      public void createLevel()
      Initializes the level by reading data from the specified file and setting up layer interactions. This method reads the level configuration from a file and then initializes the interactions between different layers of the level, such as linking traps with their corresponding mechanisms.

    • writeLevel

      public void writeLevel(String fileName)
      Writes the current state of the level to a file. This method is used for saving the level's state to a file, which can be useful for level persistence or creating snapshots of the game state at different points.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The name of the file where the level data will be written.

    • initialiseLayerInteractions

      public void initialiseLayerInteractions()
      Initializes interactions between different layers of the level. For example, this method could be used to link traps with their corresponding control mechanisms, ensuring that the game logic reflects these relationships.

    • getLevelNumber

      public int getLevelNumber()
      Retrieves the current level number of the game. The level number typically represents the sequence or difficulty level in the game.
      Returns:
      The current level number.

    • setLevelNumber

      public void setLevelNumber(int levelNumber)
      Sets the level number for the game. This method can be used to update or initialize the level to a specific sequence number.
      Parameters:
      levelNumber - The new level number to be set.

    • getTimeLimit

      public int getTimeLimit()
      Gets the time limit set for completing the level. The time limit is the maximum allowed time for players to complete the level.
      Returns:
      The time limit for the level.

    • setTimeLimit

      public void setTimeLimit(int timeLimit)
      Sets a new time limit for the level. This method is useful for adjusting the difficulty or duration of the level.
      Parameters:
      timeLimit - The new time limit to be set for the level.

    • getLevelFile

      public File getLevelFile()
      Retrieves the File object representing the file from which the level is loaded. This can include the layout, settings, and other configurations of the level.
      Returns:
      The File object representing the level file.

    • setLevelFile

      public void setLevelFile(File levelFile)
      Sets the File object representing the file for the level. This method is used to specify or change the source file for the level's configuration.
      Parameters:
      levelFile - The new File object representing the level file.

    • getWidth

      public int getWidth()
      Gets the width of the level.
      Returns:
      the width of the level

    • getActors

      public Layer<actor.Actor> getActors()

      Returns:
      The layer of actors.

    • setActors

      public void setActors(Layer<actor.Actor> actors)
      Sets the layer of actors in the level. This method allows for replacing or updating the entire actor layer.
      Parameters:
      actors - The new layer of actors to be set.

      items - The new layer of items to be set.

    • pickUp

      public void pickUp(int x, int y)
      Simulates the action of picking up an item at specified coordinates. This method is typically used to update the item layer when an item is interacted with or collected.
      Parameters:
      x - The x-coordinate where the item is picked up.
      y - The y-coordinate where the item is picked up.

    • getFILE_NOT_FOUND

      public String getFILE_NOT_FOUND()
      Retrieves the constant message used for file not found scenarios.
      Returns:
      The file not found message string.

    • getResetLevel

      public Level getResetLevel()
      Retrieves the reset level object. The reset level is typically used to restore the level to its initial state.
      Returns:
      The reset level object.

    • setResetLevel

      public void setResetLevel(Level resetLevel)
      Sets the reset level object. This method can be used to assign a new reset level for restoring the level state.
      Parameters:
      resetLevel - The new reset level to be set.

    • getFileName

      public String getFileName()
      Gets the file name from which the level data is loaded.
      Returns:
      The file name of the level.

    • setFileName

      public void setFileName(String fileName)
      Sets the file name for the level. This method is used to specify or change the file from which the level is loaded.
      Parameters:
      fileName - The new file name to be set for the level.

    • getItemsToStore

      public ArrayList<item.Item> getItemsToStore()
      Retrieves the list of items to be stored or managed within the level.
      Returns:
      The list of items to store.

    • setItemsToStore

      public void setItemsToStore(ArrayList<item.Item> itemsToStore)
      Sets the list of items to be stored within the level. This method can be used to update or manage the inventory of items in the level.
      Parameters:
      itemsToStore - The new list of items to be stored.
